item.title: Vip add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous; those in philosophy only ridiculous." -- David Hume

item.title: Vip add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Vip add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Plato was a bore." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Vip add a quote by Jacques Derrida
item.description: "What cannot be said above all must not be silenced but written." -- Jacques Derrida

item.title: Vip add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Vip add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Vip add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "To know one’s own state is not a simple matter. One cannot look directly at one’s own face with one’s own eyes, for example. One has no choice but to look at one’s reflection in the mirror. Through experience, we come to believe that the image is correct, but that is all." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Vip add a quote by Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
item.description: "What experience and history teaches us is that people and governments have never learned anything from history, or acted on principles deduced from it." -- Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

item.title: Vip add a quote by Martin Heidegger
item.description: "Why are there beings at all, instead of Nothing?" -- Martin Heidegger

item.title: Vip add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "...[G]reat progress was evident in the last Congress of the American 'Labour Union' in that among other things, it treated working women with complete equality. While in this respect the English, and still more the gallant French, are burdened with a spirit of narrow-mindedness. Anybody who knows anything of history knows that great social changes are impossible without the feminine ferment. Social progress can be measured exactly by the social position of the fair sex (the ugly ones included)." -- Karl Marx

item.title: Vip add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "I don't write a book so that it will be the final word; I write a book so that other books are possible, not necessarily written by me." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Vip add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Vip add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Vip add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Vip add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Vip add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Vip add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Interpretation is the revenge of the intellectual upon art. " -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Vip add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Vip add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Vip add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Vip add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Vip add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Vip add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Vip add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Vip add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "I do not know how to teach philosophy without becoming a disturber of the peace." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Vip add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I am one thing, my writings are another." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Vip add a quote by Hannah Arendt
item.description: "The most radical revolutionary will become a conservative the day after the revolution." -- Hannah Arendt

item.title: Vip add a quote by Fredrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Perhaps I am even envious of Stendhal? He robbed me of the best atheist joke which precisely I could have made: 'God's only excuse is that he does not exist'...I myself have said somewhere: what hitherto been the greatest objection to existence? <i>God</i>..." -- Fredrich Nietzsche

item.title: Vip add a quote by Martin Heidegger
item.description: "Tell me how you read and I'll tell you who you are." -- Martin Heidegger
